attributes.action: provide children who because of a disability, are to have a large amount of milk, recieve the milk for free.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: A lot of people with certain disabilities (including those with Osteogenesis Imperfecta) are to drink 2 pints of milk per day. At a large supermarket chain, this would cost 86p. This costs £313.90 per year per child. In the current recession, the prices are going up and people’s earnings are going down. People should be given vouchers to collect 2 pints of milk per day or a weekly voucher for when they go shopping. This could be collected from the post office or sent via the post, in the formation of a book (similar to the rations book).
